lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The goal is to identify all C crosses on the map of size N. The shape of the cross is always + (never x). Its size may differ (but at least 3x3) and it doesn't have to fit in the map (but its center is always present). They never overlap (they may touch diagonally, though).
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the size of the map
Next N lines: The map NxN. Empty space is ., cross is drawn by x.
Output
C Lines:The coordinates of the center of the cross in the form X Y, sorted by the order in which the center of the cross was printed (i.e. primarily by Y, secondarily by X), one cross on each line. The coordinates 0 0 represent top left corner.
Constraints
2 <= N <= 20
1 <= C <= 100
Example
Input
10
..........
..........
...x......
...x......
.xxxxx....
...x......
...x......
..........
..........
..........
Output
3 4
